00054 /* sequence iterator */
00055 
00056 typedef struct SeqIterator {
00057     struct Sequence **array;
00058     int tot, cur;
00059 
00060     struct Sequence *seq;
00061     int valid;
00062 } SeqIterator;
00063 
00064 void seq_begin(struct Editing *ed, SeqIterator *iter, int use_pointer);
00065 void seq_next(SeqIterator *iter);
00066 void seq_end(SeqIterator *iter);
00067 void seq_array(struct Editing *ed, struct Sequence ***seqarray, int *tot, int use_pointer);
00068 
00069 #define SEQP_BEGIN(ed, _seq)                                                  \
00070 {                                                                             \
00071     SeqIterator iter;                                                         \
00072         for (seq_begin(ed, &iter, 1); iter.valid; seq_next(&iter)) {          \
00073             _seq = iter.seq;
00074             
00075 #define SEQ_BEGIN(ed, _seq)                                                   \
00076     {                                                                         \
00077         SeqIterator iter;                                                     \
00078         for (seq_begin(ed, &iter, 0); iter.valid; seq_next(&iter)) {          \
00079             _seq = iter.seq;
00080 
00081 #define SEQ_END                                                               \
00082         }                                                                     \
00083         seq_end(&iter);                                                       \
00084     }

00093     float motion_blur_shutter;
00094 } SeqRenderData;

00114 struct SeqEffectHandle {
00115     /* constructors & destructor */
00116     /* init & init_plugin are _only_ called on first creation */
00117     void (*init)(struct Sequence *seq);
00118     void (*init_plugin)(struct Sequence *seq, const char *fname);
00119     
00120     /* number of input strips needed 
00121      * (called directly after construction) */
00122     int (*num_inputs)(void);
00123     
00124     /* load is called first time after readblenfile in
00125      * get_sequence_effect automatically */
00126     void (*load)(struct Sequence *seq);
00127     
00128     /* duplicate */
00129     void (*copy)(struct Sequence *dst, struct Sequence *src);
00130     
00131     /* destruct */
00132     void (*free)(struct Sequence *seq);
00133     
00134     /* returns: -1: no input needed,
00135      * 0: no early out,
00136      * 1: out = ibuf1,
00137      * 2: out = ibuf2 */
00138     int (*early_out)(struct Sequence *seq, float facf0, float facf1); 
00139     
00140     /* stores the y-range of the effect IPO */
00141     void (*store_icu_yrange)(struct Sequence * seq, short adrcode, float *ymin, float *ymax);
00142     
00143     /* stores the default facf0 and facf1 if no IPO is present */
00144     void (*get_default_fac)(struct Sequence *seq, float cfra, float * facf0, float * facf1);
00145     
00146     /* execute the effect
00147      * sequence effects are only required to either support
00148      * float-rects or byte-rects
00149      * (mixed cases are handled one layer up...) */
00150     
00151     struct ImBuf* (*execute)(
00152         SeqRenderData context,
00153         struct Sequence *seq, float cfra,
00154         float facf0, float facf1,
00155         struct ImBuf *ibuf1, struct ImBuf *ibuf2,
00156         struct ImBuf *ibuf3);
00157 };

00303 /* api for adding new sequence strips */
00304 typedef struct SeqLoadInfo {
00305     int start_frame;
00306     int end_frame;
00307     int channel;
00308     int flag;   /* use sound, replace sel */
00309     int type;
00310     int tot_success;
00311     int tot_error;
00312     int len;        /* only for image strips */
00313     char path[512];
00314     char name[64];
00315 } SeqLoadInfo;
00316 
00317 /* SeqLoadInfo.flag */
00318 #define SEQ_LOAD_REPLACE_SEL    (1<<0)
00319 #define SEQ_LOAD_FRAME_ADVANCE  (1<<1)
00320 #define SEQ_LOAD_MOVIE_SOUND    (1<<2)
00321 #define SEQ_LOAD_SOUND_CACHE    (1<<3)
00322 
00323 
00324 /* seq_dupli' flags */
00325 #define SEQ_DUPE_UNIQUE_NAME    (1<<0)
00326 #define SEQ_DUPE_CONTEXT        (1<<1)
00327 #define SEQ_DUPE_ANIM           (1<<2)
00328 #define SEQ_DUPE_ALL            (1<<3) /* otherwise only selected are copied */
00329
